DOCUMENT 419
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
11/6/2025 11:37 AM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION FOR CONTEMPT
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, and files this Motion for Contempt and would state as follows:
1. That on October 30, 2025, the Father filed a Motion for the Minor Child to Continue
Counseling as the Mother would not agree to sign the necessary form in order for the
minor child to continue her counseling with Deidre Leslie who was no longer with the
Child Advocacy Center;
2. That Deidre Leslie is continuing counseling at Prevail Counseling and Wellness and due
to the fact the minor child is under the age of 14, it is required for both parents to sign a
consent form;
3. That on October 30, 2025, this Court signed an Order Granting said Motion;
4. That the Father advised he has asked the Mother on two (2) occasions since the Order
was signed to sign the consent form and she still has not done so;
5. That as stated in the previous motion, the minor child, A.K.M. has established a
relationship with Deidre Leslie and feels comfortable sharing her fears and feelings with
this Counselor;
6. That Father’s attorney had planned to depose Deidre Leslie; however, Counsel did not
wish to ruin the confidential relationship between the minor child and Deidre Lewis as
Counsel felt the counseling sessions have been and will continue to be beneficial to the
minor child;
7. That the Father wishes to continue these counseling sessions to allow the minor child to
be completely candid with Deidre Lewis;
DOCUMENT 419
8. That these counseling sessions were established to help the minor child and the
relationship with her Mother.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Father requests this Court find the Mother in contempt
and compel the Mother to sign the consent form so the minor child can continue her counseling or enter
an Order that the minor child, A.K.M, dob, 05/24/2012, attend counseling sessions with Deidre Leslie at
Pevail Counseling and Wellness.
Respectfully submitted this the 6th day of November, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (Facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via
electronic filing in the AlaCourt E-File System and/or by placing a copy of same, properly
addressed and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 6th day of November, 2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel
